result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory Bernard Cotton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Gregory Bernard Cotton in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Gregory Bernard Cotton in custody.  Chris Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Erika Motsch.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght.
State moves to amend Ct. 1 in 15CF1058 to Misd Poss/RO.
Plea:
15CF1058:  Cts. 1,2,3 - G.
15CF1413:  Ct. 1 - G.
15CM1767: Ct. 3 - G.
16CF754:  Cts. 2&3 - G.

BTC:
15CF1058:  Cts. 1,2,3 - GUILTY.  
15CF1413:  Ct. 1 - GUILTY.  Ct. 2 - DRI.
15CM1767: Ct. 3 - GUILTY.  Cts. 1,2,4 - DRI.
16CF754:  Cts. 2&3 - GUILTY.  Ct. 1 - DRI.
15CM1131:  DRI.
15CM1135:  DRI.
15CM1939:  DRI.
16CF759:  DISMISSED.
PSI ordered.
Any bonds paid are to be held pending sentencing.
Plea hearing on August 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Matter was set for PLEAH.
Defendant is in custody, but a two man transport and not yet produced.
Atty Flanagan indicates that he needs to go over the plea forms and req that matter be adj.
  Plea hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Atty Patrick Flanagan
Allowing Counsel to Withdraw
ATTY Walker files motion to withdraw/proposed order forwarded to Judge for review and signature.
Plea hearing on June 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Gregory Bernard Cotton in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Gregory Bernard Cotton in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties are both prepared to proceed. The Court reviews State's MIL. No MIL filed by defense. Parties feel the trial will last a day. No Daubert or Crime Lab issues. 1 alternate, 5 strikes.

BTC: trial remains

Status conference on April 28, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on May 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Motion and Order to Consolidate

Def requests that the deft's appearance be waived.
BTC: Deft's appearance is waived.
Parties are trying to consolidate these cases with the felony files.
The Court would like to make sure that B2 is willing to take the cases.
BTC: Set matter over for control purposes.


  Status conference scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gregory Bernard Cotton in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Gregory Bernard Cotton in custody.  Matthew J Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Def is waiting on a global offer from the State.
Deft has pending felony cases 15CF1413 and 15CF1058.
Offer is to come from one source for everything.
Def is requesting an adjournment.
BTC: Matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kate Marie Simonds in court, defendant Gregory Bernard Cotton not in court, in custody.  Matthew J Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Sandra Campbell.
Deft is in custody but was not brought up.
Deft has a pending felony matter.
SPD's office has appointed atty Walker to this case who was supposed to be here.
Def is requesting an adjournment out to late January.
State does not object.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
  Status conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
